person:biography.personal-details:content: Carla Andrade is PhD Student of Psychology in ISCTE- University Institute of Lisbon, is graduated in Psychology (2007, FPCE-UC) and completed a Master in Clinical and Health Psychology (2008, FPCE-UC). Currently, she is Clinical and Health Psychologist in Centro Hospitalar Universitário do Algarve and Private Clinic, also is Assistant Professor at Instituto Superior Manuel Teixeira Gomes (ISMAT). She is Cognitive Behavioral Therapist by EABCT/APCT and teacher of Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) in certification by the Mindfulness-Based Professional Training Institute of University of California, San Diego. Membership of American Psychological Association (APA), Ordem dos Psicólogos Portugueses (OPP) and EABCT/APCT. Research Interest: 1. The study of emotion regulation strategies of self-conscious emotions, specifically the study of efficacy of mindfulness and self-compassion strategies in regulation of shame and guilt and prosocial behaviors. 2. Individual and contextual factors related to intimate psychological violence in adults.

keyword:keyword.keyword:content: Mindfulness; Self-compassion; Emotions; Behaviors; Psychopathology; Health; Psychophysiology.
